reviews.text: Great quality B&B!
reviews.title: 4* B&B in style

likes.liked: — Remember to ask for the Wi-Fi access code

reviews.title: Best Bed & Breakfast for miles!
reviews.text: The best features:
- Modern (Very stylish furniture)
reviews.title: Great place to stay to visit Oxford and the Cotswolds
Friendly and accommodating
reviews.text: - Clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Friendly and knowledgable owners
reviews.title: A great stay at Tilbury Lodge

likes.liked: — Nice room, good bathroom, great breakfast
likes.disliked: — bus route was confusing, small small sink

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a really lovely stay a few weeks back! Tilbury Lodge is on a quiet, really pretty little street but downtown is easily reachable by bus. Our room was really comfortable but not fancy -- what put this B&B over the top for us was the little touches everywhere. Fruit baskets, candies, muffins and even fudge in the room. Our afternoon teacups were already set up with a biscuit on the side, these little details were just perfect. Stefan, the owner, even let us keep our car there after we had checked out so we could meet a friend in Oxford. Very nice cooked breakfast, we had the vegetarian version with veggie sausages, and someone even made sure the muffins in our room were veg. I would highly recommend!
reviews.title: a winner!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent one night at Tilbury Lodge. The place is really nice and you can feel the effort they have put into setting up the rooms.
reviews.title: Nice and relaxing night at Tilbury Lodge

likes.disliked: — A bit far away from city center, but not an issue if you have a car

reviews.text: Our room was very nice and even had some relaxation CDs, a foot massage machine and a very nice bathroom.
reviews.title: Great B&B

likes.liked: — friendly and kind hosts, clean place, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lodge is located not too far away from Oxford's city center, but you would need either a car (as we did...) or catch a bus.
reviews.title: Lovely B&B would recommend it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very good!
reviews.title: Just what we wanted

reviews.text: I arrived exhausted and nervy; departed two days later totally relaxed and happy, ready for a challenging week in a more urban setting. Tilbury hospitality was warm and immediate: hearing I was tired, I was immediately settled into my room and brought a lovely tea tray. My weary feet found a footbath and my aching head soft pillows. The tea didn't hurt either.
reviews.title: Wonderful! And excellent dogs!

likes.disliked: — far from center, which was an advantage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hearing that I adore dogs, the owners' two Jack Russells - Jax and Russell - were shared as well. I spent happy hours in the garden playing with the dogs and refreshing spirit and soul.
reviews.title: A nice stay @ Tilbury Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highest compliments to Tilbury; it is now tops on my list!
reviews.title: A splendid B&B

likes.liked: — Foot spa and all the little extra touches

reviews.title: Wonderful B+B
reviews.text: I stayed @ this B&B for one night with my boyfriend late March 2007. I booked the room over the phone & found the owner to be most helpful with directions to Oxford.

reviews.title: My stay at the Tilbury
reviews.text: Upon arrival we were shown into a room on the ground floor (#3, I believe) which was nicely appointed with complimentary Asian-style dressing gowns and other goodies i.e. drinks/ cupasoup etc

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent two nights in November at the Tilbury Lodge. I found it using TripAdvisor and boy am I glad I did!
reviews.title: Our Home Away From Home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay in Oxford after three exhausting days and sleepless nights in London. Our room was upstairs and looked out on to the picturesque garden and surrounding landscape.
reviews.title: Refreshingly different

likes.liked: — Modern, friendly, clean, hot shower and flat screen tv

reviews.text: The area is very quiet at night so we both slept very well in the comfortable, cozy bed....just like home! The bathroom, though small had a great shower with lots of hot water and a towel heater! Grabbing a warm towel when you jump out of the shower is heaven!
reviews.title: Simply Superb!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was tastefully decorated with a flat panel TV and plenty of closet space. There were treats and snacks, tea/coffee, soda and even beer in the room, which was great when you felt a bit peckish or wanted a late night beverage.
reviews.title: Great Bed and Breakfast

likes.liked: — Peaceful atmosphere, friendly staff, great breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stefan is the ultimate host and a great cook! I think he is what makes the lodge so special. A great conversationalist with lots of tips and advice about seeing Oxford. We are so glad we took his advice to take a walking tour of the university. There is no way we would have seen or learned what we did on our own. Well worth doing!
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay!
